gurmukhi: ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰੁੱਝੇ ਸਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਸੂਰੰ || ਘਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਘੁੱਮੀ ਹਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਹੂਰੰ || ਤਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਤੱਕੈ ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜੁਅਾਨੰ || ਮਾਰੜਦੰਗ ਮੋਹੀ ਤਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਤਾਨੰ ||੩੬੬||
transliteration: Raagaddan Rujjhe Saagaddan Sooran|| Ghaagaddan Ghoummihaagaddan Hooran|| Taagaddan Takkai Jaagaddan Juaanan|| Maagaddan Mohitaagaddan Taanan||366||
translation: The warriors are absorbed in fighting and the heavenly damsels are moving for wedding them; the warriors are looking at them and they are also fascinated by them.366.

gurmukhi: ਦਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਦੇਖੈ ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰੂਪੰ || ਪਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਪ੍ਰੇਮੰ ਕਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਕੂਪੰ || ਡਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਡੁੱਬੀ ਪਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਪਿਅਾਰੀ || ਕਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਕਾਮੰ ਮਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਮਾਰੀ ||੩੬੭||
transliteration: Daagaddan Dekhai Raagaddan Roopan|| Paagaddan Preman Kaagaddan Koopan|| Daagaddan Doubbipaagaddan Pidaree|| Kaagaddan Kaamannd Maagaddan Mdaree||367||
translation: Their beauty allures the lovers like falling in the well, wherefrom they can never come out; these heavenly damsels have also drowned themselves in the sexual love of the beautiful warriors.367.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਮੋਹੀ ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬਾਲਾ || ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰੂਪੰ ਅਾਗੜਦੰਗ ੳੁਜਾਲਾ || ਦਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਦੇਖੈ ਸਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਸੂਰੰ || ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬਾਜੇ ਤਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਤੂਰੰ ||੩੬੮||
transliteration: Maagaddan Mohibaagaddan Baalaa|| Raagaddan Roopan Aagaddan Ujaalaa|| Daagaddan Dekhai Saagaddan Sooran|| Baagaddan Baaje Taagaddan Tooran||368||
translation: The women are getting allured and there is brightness of their elegance; the warriors seeing them are playing on various kinds of musical instruments.368.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਗੜਦੰਘ ਰੂਪੰ ਕਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਕਾਮੰ || ਨਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਨਾਚੈ ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬਾਮੰ || ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰੀਝੇ ਸਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਸੂਰੰ || ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬਿਅਾਹੈ ਹਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਹੂਰੰ ||੩੬੯||
transliteration: Raagaddan Roopan Kaagaddan Kaamannd|| Naagaddan Naache Baagaddan Baamannd|| Raagaddan Reejhe Saagaddan Sooran|| Baagaddan Biaahai Haagaddan Hooran||369||
translation: The women, full of beauty and lust are dancing and the warriors, getting pleased are wedding them.369.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਕੋਪਾ ਭਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਭੂਪੰ || ਕਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਕਾਲੰ ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰੂਪੰ || ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰੋਸੰ ਧਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਧਾਯੋ || ਚਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਚਲਯੋ ਅਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਅਾਯੋ ||੩੭੦||
transliteration: Kaagaddan Kopaa Bhaagaddan Bhoopan|| Kaagaddan Kaalan Raagaddan Roopan|| Raagaddan Rosan|| Dhaagaddan Dhaayo|| Chaagaddan Chadyo Aagaddan Aayo||370||
translation: The king, getting infuriated, manifested himself as KAL (death) and in his anger, quickly advanced forward.370.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਅਰੜੇ ਗਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਗਾਜੀ || ਨਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਨਾਚੇ ਤਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਤਾਜੀ || ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜੁੱਝੇ ਖਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਖੇਤੰ || ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰਹਸੇ ਪਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਪ੍ਰੇਤੰ ||੩੭੧||
transliteration: Aagaddan Arade Gadgaddan Gadjee|| Naagaddan Naache Taagaddan Taajee|| Jaagaddan Jujjhe Khadganndan Khetan|| Raagaddan Rahse Paagaddan Pretan||371||
translation: The warriors shouted, the horses danced, the fighters died and the ghosts etc. became pleased.371.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਮਾਰੇ ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬੀਰੰ || ਪਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਪਰਾਨੇ ਭਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਭੀਰੰ || ਧਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਧਾਯੋ ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰਾਜਾ || ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰਣਕੇ ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬਾਜਾ ||੩੭੨||
transliteration: Maagaddan Mdare Taagaddan Bderan|| Paagaddan Paraane Bhaagaddan Bhderan|| Dhaagaddan Dhaayo Raagaddan Raajaa|| Raagaddan Ranke Baagaddan Baajaa||372||
translation: The warriors were being killed and the cowards began to run away; the king also fell upon the opponents and the musical instruments of war were played.372.

gurmukhi: ਟਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਟੂਟੇ ਤਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਤਾਲੰ || ਅਾਗੜਦੰਗ ੳੁੱਠੇ ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜੁਅਾਲੰ || ਭਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਭਾਜੇ ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬੀਰੰ || ਲਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਲਾਗੇ ਤਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਤੀਰੰ ||੩੭੩||
transliteration: Taagaddan Toote Taagaddan Taalan|| Aagaddan Outthe Jaagaddan Juaalan|| Bhaagadbhaaje Baagaddan Bderan|| Laagaddan Laage Taagaddan Tderan||373||
translation: The swords were broken and fires blazed; with the infliction of arrows the warriors ran hither and thither.373.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰਹਸੀ ਦਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਦੇਵੀ || ਗਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਗੈਣੰ ਅਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਭੇਵੀ || ਭਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਭੈਰੋ ਪਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਪ੍ਰੇਤੰ || ਹਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਹੱਸੇ ਖਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਖੇਤੰ ||੩੭੪||
transliteration: Raagaddan Rahsidaagaddan Devee|| Gadgaddan Gadnan Aagaddan Bhevi|| Bhaagaddan Bhairo Paagaddan Pretan|| Haagaddan Hasse Khadganndan Khetan||374||
translation: Seeing the war, the goddess Kali also pleased in the sky; the Bhairav and ghosts etc. also in the battlefield.374.

gurmukhi: ਅਸ ਟੁੱਟੇ ਲੁੱਟੇ ਘਨੇ ਤੁੱਟੇ ਸ਼ਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਨੇਕ || ਜੇ ਜੁੱਟੇ ਕੱਟੇ ਸਭੈ ਰਹਿ ਗਯੋ ਭੂਪਤ ੲੇਕ ||੩੭੫||
transliteration: As Toutte Loutte Ghane Toutte Shastra Anek|| Je Joutte Katte Sabhai Rah(i) Gyo Bhoopat Ek||375||
translation: The swords broke and many weapons were shattered into bits; those warriors who fought, were chopped and ultimately only the king survived.375.

gurmukhi: ਸੈਨ ਜੁਝਤ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਭਯੋ ਅਤਿ ਅਾਕਲ || ਧਾਵਤ ਭਯੋ ਸਾਮੁਹਿ ਅਤਿ ਬਿਅਾਕਲ ||
transliteration: Sain Jujhat Nrip Bhayo At(i) Aakal|| Dhaavat Bhyo Saamuh(i) At(i) Biaakal||
translation: On the destruction of his army, the king extremely agitated went forward and came at the front;

gurmukhi: ਸੰਨਿਧ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਚਿਤ ਮੈ ਅਤਿ ਕ੍ਰੁੱਧਤ || ਅਾਵਤ ਭਯੋ ਰਿਸ ਕੈ ਕਰਿ ਜੁੱਧਤ ||੩੭੬||
transliteration: Sannikh Hvai Vhit Mai At(i) Kruddhat|| Aavatbhayo Ris Kai Kar(i) Juddhat||376||
translation: Getting extremely angry in his mind and moved forward in order to fight.376.
